system

Class AuctionDateTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • system.AuctionDateTester

  •  class AuctionDateTester
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a tester used to test if the new Auction would added to the AuctionList meet all requirements (Business Rule #1,2,3,4).
    Version:
    Win. 2014
    Author:
    Kaiyuan Shi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Auction> myAuction
      The list of the current Auction list.
      private boolean mySolution
      The solution of the tester.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private int calculate7Day(java.util.Calendar auctionDate)
      This method calculate how many Auctions in the list in 7 days after the parameter's Date
      boolean getSolution()
      This method get the solution of the test.
      private boolean is2Hour(Auction before, Auction after)
      This method test if the second auction begin after at least 2 hours the first auction finish.
      private boolean test1DayFull(Auction anAuction)
      This method test if the the new Auction was added, would be more than 2 Auctions in 2 hours.

      This method test if the new Auction was added, would be more than 5 Auctions in 7 days.

      This method test if the new Auction's date is in 3 month after today.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuctionDateTester

        public AuctionDateTester(Auction anAuction,
                 java.util.List<Auction> anAuctionList)
        The constructor of the tester
        Parameters:
        anAuction - the new Auction would added to the AuctionList
        anAuctionList - current Auction list

    • Method Detail

      • getSolution

        public boolean getSolution()
        This method get the solution of the test.
        Returns:
        the solution of the test, true if the new Auction can be added, false if the new Auction can not be added

      • testIn3Month

        private boolean testIn3Month(java.util.Calendar today,
                   java.util.Calendar auctionDate)
        This method test if the new Auction's date is in 3 month after today.
        Parameters:
        today - today's date
        auctionDate - new Auction's date
        Returns:
        true if new Auction's date is in 3 month after today, false if new Auction's date is not in 3 month after today.

      • test7DayFull

        private boolean test7DayFull(Auction anAuction)
        This method test if the new Auction was added, would be more than 5 Auctions in 7 days.
        Parameters:
        anAuction - the new Auction would added to the AuctionList
        Returns:
        true if more than 5 Auctions in 7 days, false if no more than 5 Auctions in 7 days

      • calculate7Day

        private int calculate7Day(java.util.Calendar auctionDate)
        This method calculate how many Auctions in the list in 7 days after the parameter's Date
        Parameters:
        auctionDate - a Date that be started
        Returns:
        the number of Auctions in the list in 7 days after the parameter's Date

      • test1DayFull

        private boolean test1DayFull(Auction anAuction)
        This method test if the the new Auction was added, would be more than 2 Auctions in 2 hours.
        Parameters:
        auctionDate - anAuction the new Auction would added to the AuctionList
        Returns:
        true if there would be more than 2 Auctions in 2 hours, else false

      • is2Hour

        private boolean is2Hour(Auction before,
              Auction after)
        This method test if the second auction begin after at least 2 hours the first auction finish.
        Parameters:
        before - the auction that begin first
        after - the auction that begin second
        Returns:
        true if the second auction begin after at least 2 hours the first auction finish, else false
